benchmark_details.name: Open Causal Discovery Benchmark (OCDB)
benchmark_details.overview: The OCDB is a comprehensive evaluation framework for causal discovery algorithms based on real datasets, designed to enhance interpretability and assess causal structures and effects effectively.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized, open platform for the evaluation of causal discovery algorithms using real-world datasets.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The computational complexity of CED is high, which may hinder its application on larger datasets.

data.source: Real-world datasets covering various domains, curated for causal discovery tasks.
data.annotation: Data is curated from multiple sources and processed uniformly.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the differences in causal structures and causal effects.
methodology.interpretation: Lower values indicate better performance in discovering causal relationships.
methodology.baseline_results: Detailed results provided for various causal discovery methods and datasets.
methodology.validation: Experimental validation against baseline models and existing benchmarks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of variables and their interactions across different datasets included.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All datasets are publicly available for research purposes.
